about.headline: Infrastructure Architect & Machine Learning Developer
paragraphs: I design resilient cloud automation and intelligent forecasting systems that help teams deploy faster and make smarter decisions. From AWS infrastructure to quantitative modeling, my work blends scalability with data-driven insights.

Currently, I support SamaritanApps as an Infrastructure Architect while studying Computer Science (Specialist) and Mathematics (Major) at the University of Toronto. I lead cross-functional teams, streamline DevOps workflows, and turn research into production-ready tools.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science (BSc), Computer Science (Specialist) & Mathematics (Major)
highlights: Coursework includes algorithms, statistical learning, and advanced calculus.
Active contributor to Quant, AI, & Fintech Society (QAIFS).

experience.title: Infrastructure Architect
experience.summary: Design and manage AWS infrastructure with a focus on automation, scalability, and strong security practices.
achievements: Built Infrastructure-as-a-Service automation pipelines to minimize manual setup time.
Led migration of services across S3, EC2, and IAM with hardened access policies.

experience.title: Vice President, Web Development
experience.summary: Direct the buildout of member-facing portals and digital tools used across a 200+ student organization.
achievements: Led development of member portal and digital tools supporting student-led research and events.
Introduced CI/CD pipelines, cutting deployment time from days to hours.

experience.title: Machine Learning Developer & Researcher
experience.summary: Prototype and evaluate machine learning models for financial forecasting and quantitative research.
achievements: Developed ML models for financial forecasting and quantitative research initiatives.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to communicate findings to the executive board.

experience.title: Software Developer
experience.summary: Built internal tooling to manage oversight of access rights and track permissions across stakeholders.
achievements: Developed SQL database to centralize access rights and track permissions.
Built Flask-based admin panel to visualize logs and adjust access controls.

projects.name: Portfolio Optimization with LSTM Forecasting
projects.problem: Investors need forecasts and optimization tools that adapt quickly to market signals without sacrificing accuracy.
projects.solution: Implemented an LSTM neural network in PyTorch to forecast stock returns, integrated the results into a mean-variance optimization pipeline, and accelerated training through CUDA.
projects.impact: Reduced training runtime by up to 4× compared to CPU, evaluated strategies with Sharpe ratio and expected return, and visualized efficient frontier allocations.

projects.name: Chess Tournament Platform
projects.problem: Coordinating chess tournaments requires seamless scheduling, pairing, and engagement tools for participants.
projects.solution: Built a full-stack application with React, Tailwind CSS, Express.js/Node.js, and PocketBase to manage tournaments, track results, and deliver real-time notifications.
projects.impact: Delivered an intuitive interface with automated pairing, admin notifications, and responsive design across devices.

projects.name: User Management Application
projects.problem: Reena Group needed a streamlined way to manage user roles, status, and permissions across teams.
projects.solution: Developed a three-tier desktop system in Python leveraging SQLite and decorators to enforce role-based access control and performance logging.
projects.impact: Improved administrative efficiency with pagination, search, and clean separation between UI, logic, and data layers.

meta.tagline: Automation, cloud infrastructure, and data-driven insights for resilient systems.
meta.availability: Open to internships and collaborative projects in infrastructure, ML, or fintech.
